hook.text: Terri Schiavo lay in a vegetative state for 15 years while her husband and parents fought over her fate.

buildup.text: An advance directive is a legal document stating your medical wishes in case you can't speak for yourself.

discovery.text: Living wills and healthcare proxies let you decide now what happens to you laterâ€”before a crisis strikes.

twist.text: Only about one-third of Americans have one. Most people avoid the conversation until it's too late.

climax.text: Without a directive, families guess, doctors default to aggressive treatment, and courts get involved.

punchline.text: Write your wishes down. Silence is not a plan.

quiz.question: What happens when a patient lacks an advance directive and becomes incapacitated?
options: The government decides treatment based on standardized rules
Families must guess, doctors default to aggressive care, and courts may get involved
